comments:
Using I20060905-1250, I got this NPE when trying to import a small jar'd plugin.
I'll attach it.

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.converter.PDEPluginConverter.modifyBundleClasspathHeader(PDEPluginConverter.java:146)
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.imports.PluginImportOperation.extractJARdPlugin(PluginImportOperation.java:555)
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.imports.PluginImportOperation.importAsBinary(PluginImportOperation.java:280)
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.imports.PluginImportOperation.importPlugin(PluginImportOperation.java:214)
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.imports.PluginImportOperation.run(PluginImportOperation.java:126)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1737)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1719)
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.imports.PluginImportWizard$2.run(PluginImportWizard.java:114)
at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

Created an attachment (id=49510)
Attached plugin

1) Unzip this plugin in the plugins directory of an eclipse install
2) Start Eclipse
3) Start a self-hosting workspace
4) Import this plugin as a binary plugin using the import wizard.
5) It should fail with this NPE
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 156298 ***
this was the reason for the rebuild today.

The plugin is not jar'd anymore.
Now with I20060906-1200, I get:

Oliver, thanks for catching my mistakes.  The stack trace in comment #1 was a dup to the bug Wassim mentioned.  The stack trace in comment #2 is a different problem (comes from the editor, not the import operation).  You opened bug 156385 to track this error :)

I am going to mark this bug a dup for the original stack trace, since the second stack trace deal with bug 156385 and not importing a plugin as the title describes.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 156298 ***
